item.name: New release of Ubuntu is available
item.key: system.run["/usr/lib/ubuntu-release-upgrader/release-upgrade-motd | grep -q 'New release' && /usr/lib/ubuntu-release-upgrader/release-upgrade-motd | grep 'New release' | cut -d\"'\" -f2 | tail -n 1 || echo 'No new release available.'"]
item.description: Checks if there is any newer Ubuntu release available. When running on a LTS version it will only check for newer LTS versions.

item.name: Number of partitions with less than 5% available space left
item.key: system.run["df -h | grep -v ^// | grep -v '[/]snap' | grep -v '/tmp/sanity-mountpoint-' | awk '{ print $5 }' | grep -E '^((9[5-9])|100)%$' | wc -l"]

item.name: Processor load (1 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: VMware tools is not running
item.key: system.run["grep -qs 'Vendor: VMware' /proc/scsi/scsi && if ps -ef | grep -v grep | grep -qis vmtoolsd; then echo 0; else echo 1; fi || echo 0"]

item.name: Total size of open deleted file descriptors
item.key: system.run["test -e /etc/sudoers.d/zabbix && sudo -n lsof / | grep deleted | awk '{s+=$7/1024/1024/1024} END {print s}'"]

item.name: Number of file systems
item.key: system.run["timeout 1.0 df -ah | tail -n +2 | awk '{print $2\" \"$1\" \"$6}' | grep -E -v '^(0|-)' | awk '{print $3}' | grep -v '^/run/user/' | grep -v '^/snap/core/' | wc -l || echo 0"]

trigger.expression: ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["free | awk 'FNR == 3 {printf \"%.1f\n\", $3/($3+$4)*100}'"].last(0)}>90) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["free | awk 'FNR == 3 {printf \"%.1f\n\", $3/($3+$4)*100}'"].last(0)}>86)
trigger.name: High memory usage ({ITEM.LASTVALUE}) on {HOST.NAME}

dependency.name: High memory usage ({ITEM.LASTVALUE}) on {HOST.NAME}
dependency.expression: ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["free | awk 'FNR == 3 {printf \"%.1f\n\", $3/($3+$4)*100}'"].last(0)}>95) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["free | awk 'FNR == 3 {printf \"%.1f\n\", $3/($3+$4)*100}'"].last(0)}>91)

trigger.expression: ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["free | awk 'FNR == 3 {printf \"%.1f\n\", $3/($3+$4)*100}'"].last(0)}>95) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["free | awk 'FNR == 3 {printf \"%.1f\n\", $3/($3+$4)*100}'"].last(0)}>91)
trigger.name: High memory usage ({ITEM.LASTVALUE}) on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["df -h | grep -v ^// | grep -v '[/]snap' | grep -v '/tmp/sanity-mountpoint-' | awk '{ print $5 }' | grep -E '^((9[5-9])|100)%$' | wc -l"].last(0)}>0
trigger.name: Less than 5% space left on a partition on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["ps hrf -opid,cmd -C rsync | grep -v '\\_' | wc -l"].last()}=0 and ( ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["echo $(cat /proc/loadavg | cut -d ' ' -f 2) $(nproc) | awk '{ print $1/$2 }'"].avg(2m)}>0.7) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["echo $(cat /proc/loadavg | cut -d ' ' -f 2) $(nproc) | awk '{ print $1/$2 }'"].avg(2m)}>0.6) )
trigger.name: Load average is too high on {HOST.NAME} ({ITEM.LASTVALUE2} avg per core)

dependency.name: Load average is too high on {HOST.NAME} ({ITEM.LASTVALUE2} avg per core)
dependency.expression: {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["ps hrf -opid,cmd -C rsync | grep -v '\\_' | wc -l"].last()}=0 and ( ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["echo $(cat /proc/loadavg | cut -d ' ' -f 2) $(nproc) | awk '{ print $1/$2 }'"].avg(2m)}>0.9) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["echo $(cat /proc/loadavg | cut -d ' ' -f 2) $(nproc) | awk '{ print $1/$2 }'"].avg(2m)}>0.7) )

trigger.expression: {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["ps hrf -opid,cmd -C rsync | grep -v '\\_' | wc -l"].last()}=0 and ( ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["echo $(cat /proc/loadavg | cut -d ' ' -f 2) $(nproc) | awk '{ print $1/$2 }'"].avg(2m)}>0.9) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["echo $(cat /proc/loadavg | cut -d ' ' -f 2) $(nproc) | awk '{ print $1/$2 }'"].avg(2m)}>0.7) )
trigger.name: Load average is too high on {HOST.NAME} ({ITEM.LASTVALUE2} avg per core)

dependency.name: Load average is too high on {HOST.NAME} ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} avg per core)
dependency.expression: ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["echo $(cat /proc/loadavg | cut -d ' ' -f 2) $(nproc) | awk '{ print $1/$2 }'"].avg(2m)}>1.5) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["echo $(cat /proc/loadavg | cut -d ' ' -f 2) $(nproc) | awk '{ print $1/$2 }'"].avg(2m)}>0.9)

trigger.expression: ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["echo $(cat /proc/loadavg | cut -d ' ' -f 2) $(nproc) | awk '{ print $1/$2 }'"].avg(2m)}>1.5) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["echo $(cat /proc/loadavg | cut -d ' ' -f 2) $(nproc) | awk '{ print $1/$2 }'"].avg(2m)}>0.9)
trigger.name: Load average is too high on {HOST.NAME} ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} avg per core)

trigger.expression: {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["test -e /etc/sudoers.d/zabbix && sudo -n lsof / | grep deleted | awk '{s+=$7/1024/1024/1024} END {print s}'"].last(0)}>1
trigger.name: More than 1 GB open deleted file descriptors on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["/usr/lib/ubuntu-release-upgrader/release-upgrade-motd | grep -q 'New release' && /usr/lib/ubuntu-release-upgrader/release-upgrade-motd | grep 'New release' | cut -d\"'\" -f2 | tail -n 1 || echo 'No new release available.'"].str(No new)}=0
trigger.name: New Ubuntu OS ({ITEM.LASTVALUE}) available on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["apt-get autoremove --dry-run | grep 'Remv' | wc -l"].last(0)}>10
trigger.name: No longer required packages installed on {HOSTNAME} ({ITEM.LASTVALUE})

trigger.expression: {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["test -e /var/run/reboot-required && echo 1 || echo 0"].last(0)}>0
trigger.name: System reboot required on {HOSTNAME}

trigger.expression: {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["timeout 1.0 df -ah | tail -n +2 | awk '{print $2\" \"$1\" \"$6}' | grep -E -v '^(0|-)' | awk '{print $3}' | grep -v '^/run/user/' | grep -v '^/snap/core/' | wc -l || echo 0"].last(0)}<{Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["timeout 1.0 df -ah | tail -n +2 | awk '{print $2\" \"$1\" \"$6}' | grep -E -v '^(0|-)' | awk '{print $3}' | grep -v '^/run/user/' | grep -v '^/snap/core/' | wc -l || echo 0"].max(1d)} and {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["timeout 1.0 df -ah | tail -n +2 | awk '{print $2\" \"$1\" \"$6}' | grep -E -v '^(0|-)' | awk '{print $3}' | grep -v '^/run/user/' | grep -v '^/snap/core/' | wc -l || echo 0"].last(0)}>0
trigger.name: The number of file systems has decreased on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Check for decreasing number of file systems, such as missing nfs or cifs mounted file systems.

trigger.expression: {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["timeout 1.0 df -ah | tail -n +2 | awk '{print $2\" \"$1\" \"$6}' | grep -E -v '^(0|-)' | awk '{print $3}' | grep -v '^/run/user/' | grep -v '^/snap/core/' | wc -l || echo 0"].count(#2,0)}>1
trigger.name: Unresponsive file systems on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Check if the file systems are responding, so that unresponsive nfs or cifs mounted file systems can be noticed in time.

trigger.expression: {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["cat /etc/ssh/sshd_config | grep -q '^PasswordAuthentication no$' && echo 0 || echo 1"].last(0)}>0
trigger.name: Unsafe configuration: Password logins via SSH is enabled on {HOSTNAME}

trigger.expression: {Template OS Ubuntu - Jim Cronqvist:system.run["grep -qs 'Vendor: VMware' /proc/scsi/scsi && if ps -ef | grep -v grep | grep -qis vmtoolsd; then echo 0; else echo 1; fi || echo 0"].last(0)}>0
trigger.name: VMware tools is not running on {HOSTNAME}
